Added GET /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}/results?beta=true to stream Message Batch results as a .jsonl (application/x-jsonl) file. Each line is a per-request result (succeeded/errored/canceled/expired) with custom_id for matching; supports anthropic-beta and anthropic-version headers.

Removed beta endpoint GET /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}/results?beta=true which streamed Message Batch results as a .jsonl (JSON Lines) file, one line per request result (use custom_id to correlate; order not guaranteed).

Adds DELETE /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}?beta=true to delete a Message Batch by ID. Batches can be deleted only after processing completes; inprogress batches must be canceled first. Returns a confirmation object with id and type=message_batch_deleted.

Introduces POST /v1/messages/batches?beta=true to create and process batches of Messages API requests. Accepts up to 100k message-creation requests, starts processing immediately (may take up to 24h), and returns a MessageBatch with status, request counts, and a results_url (JSONL) when complete.
Removed the beta Message Batches creation endpoint that submitted multiple Messages API requests and returned batch metadata/results_url (POST /v1/messages/batches?beta=true).

Introduces deprecated GET /assistants to return a paginated, sortable list of assistant objects; supports limit, order (asc/desc), and cursor-based pagination with before/after.

Introduces POST /assistants (deprecated) to create an assistant configured with a model, instructions, optional tools (code_interpreter, file_search, function), tool resources, and generation params (temperature, top_p, response_format, reasoning_effort). Returns the Assistant object with IDs and metadata.
Added deprecated DELETE /assistants/{assistant_id} to delete an assistant and return a confirmation object (id, object=assistant.deleted, deleted=true).
Introduces GET /assistants/{assistant_id} to fetch a specific assistant by ID; returns the (deprecated) Assistant object.

Introduces POST /assistants/{assistant_id} to modify an existing assistant (name, description, instructions, model, sampling/settings, tools, tool_resources, metadata, reasoning_effort); returns the updated Assistant object. This route is marked deprecated.
Added POST /audio/speech to generate text-to-speech audio from text, returning an audio file or streamed audio events.

Adds POST /audio/transcriptions to convert uploaded audio to text. Supports Whisper and GPT-4o transcribe models, optional diarization with speaker labels, configurable chunking (auto/server_vad), server-sent events streaming, and multiple output formats (json, diarized_json, verbose_json). Accepts multipart/form-data with file and model plus options like language, prompt, temperature, timestamps, and logprobs.

Adds POST /audio/translations to translate uploaded audio to English using whisper-1. Accepts multipart form-data with file and model (optional prompt, response_format, temperature). Returns plain text or verbose JSON (with language, duration, and segments).
Added GET /audio/voice_consents to list voice consent recordings with pagination (after, limit).
Adds POST /audio/voice_consents to upload a consent audio recording (name, language, file) authorizing custom voice creation; returns a voice_consent object.
Adds DELETE /audio/voice_consents/{consent_id} to delete a voice consent recording by ID; returns id, object, and deleted status.
Adds GET /audio/voice_consents/{consent_id} to retrieve metadata for a voice consent recording used to authorize creation of custom voices. Returns id, name, language, created_at, and object type.

Introduces POST /audio/voice_consents/{consent_id} to update a consent recordings metadata (name) for custom voices; does not alter or replace the underlying audio and returns the updated voice consent object.
Adds POST /audio/voices to create a custom voice from an audio sample and consent recording; returns a Voice object.

Introduces GET /batches to list your organization's batches with cursor pagination (after, limit), returning a list of batch objects and related metadata (status, timestamps, counts, file IDs, usage).

Adds POST /batches to create and execute a batch job from an uploaded JSONL file of requests (purpose=batch), targeting one supported endpoint (e.g., /v1/responses, /v1/chat/completions, /v1/embeddings, etc.) within a 24h completion window; returns a batch object with IDs, status, timestamps, counts, and optional usage.

Introduces POST /batches/{batch_id}/cancel to cancel an in-progress batch. The batch enters cancelling (up to 10 minutes) before becoming cancelled, potentially with partial results; responds with the cancelling batch's details.
Introduces GET /batches/{batch_id} to retrieve a batch by ID, returning its status, timestamps, input/output file IDs, request counts, model, metadata, and usage (when available).
Introduces GET /chat/completions to list stored Chat Completions (store=true) with optional model/metadata filters, ordering, and pagination.
Introduces POST /chat/completions to create model responses for chat conversations, supporting text/audio output, multimodal inputs, streaming, tool calling, structured outputs, and web search.
Introduces DELETE /chat/completions/{completion_id} to delete a stored chat completion by ID (only if created with store=true). Returns the deleted object type, its ID, and a deleted flag.
Adds GET /chat/completions/{completion_id} to retrieve a stored chat completion by ID. Only returns completions created with store=true.

Introduces GET /chat/completions/{completion_id}/messages to retrieve messages from a stored chat completion by ID, with pagination (after, limit) and sort ordering (asc|desc); returns a list of assistant messages with metadata.

Introduces POST /chat/completions/{completion_id} to modify a stored chat completion by ID. Only completions created with store=true can be edited, and the only supported update is to the metadata field.

Introduces POST /chatkit/sessions to create a ChatKit session for a specified workflow and user, with optional configuration, rate limit, and expiration overrides; returns the session object including client_secret and resolved settings.

Introduces POST /chatkit/sessions/{session_id}/cancel to cancel an active ChatKit session, blocking future use of its client_secret and returning the latest session metadata with status set to cancelled.
Introduces GET /chatkit/threads to list ChatKit threads with optional pagination and user filters.
Introduces DELETE /chatkit/threads/{thread_id} to remove a ChatKit thread and all its items and stored attachments, returning a confirmation object (id, deleted, object='chatkit.thread.deleted').

Introduces GET /chatkit/threads/{thread_id} to fetch a ChatKit thread by its identifier, returning the thread object with created_at, id, object, status (active|locked|closed with optional reason), title (nullable), and user.

Introduces GET /chatkit/threads/{thread_id}/items to fetch a paginated list of thread items (user/assistant messages, widgets, client tool calls, tasks) with limit/order and cursor (before/after) controls.
Added POST /completions endpoint to create text completions for prompts; supports JSON body with model, prompt, generation controls, and optional SSE streaming.
Adds GET /containers to list containers with pagination (limit/after), optional name filtering, and sorting by created_at.
Added POST /containers to create a container with optional files, skills, memory limits, and network policies.
Adds DELETE /containers/{container_id} to delete a container by its ID.

Introduces GET /containers/{container_id}/files to list a container's files. Supports limit, order, and after for pagination; returns a list of container.file objects with metadata (id, path, bytes, created_at, container_id, source).

Adds POST /containers/{container_id}/files to create a file in a container. Accepts multipart/form-data with raw file content or JSON with a file_id; returns the container file object with metadata (id, path, bytes, source, etc.).
Added endpoint to retrieve the raw content of a specific file within a container by IDs.
Adds DELETE /containers/{container_id}/files/{file_id} to delete a file within a container by ID; returns 200 OK on success.
Added GET /containers/{container_id}/files/{file_id} to retrieve a container file object (metadata) by container and file ID.
Added GET /containers/{container_id} to retrieve a container by ID, returning metadata such as name, status, timestamps, memory_limit, network_policy, and expiration settings.

Introduces POST /conversations to create a new conversation. The request can include optional initial items (messages, tool-call contexts, up to 20) and metadata; the response returns the conversation id, object type, metadata, and created_at timestamp.
New endpoint DELETE /conversations/{conversation_id} to delete a conversation; items remain.
New endpoint to fetch a single conversation by ID, returning id, object (conversation), metadata, and created_at.
Introduces GET /conversations/{conversation_id}/items to list a conversations items with pagination, ordering, and optional include fields.

POST /conversations/{conversation_id}/items: Create up to 20 items (messages, tool calls, outputs, reasoning, etc.) in a conversation and return a list of conversation items. Supports optional include[] for extra fields.
Adds DELETE /conversations/{conversation_id}/items/{item_id} to delete a specific item from a conversation by IDs; returns the conversation object on success.

Adds GET /conversations/{conversation_id}/items/{item_id} to retrieve a single item from a conversation by IDs. Supports optional include[] query to request extra fields; returns a polymorphic Conversation item (message, tool calls, reasoning, etc.).

Introduces POST /conversations/{conversation_id} to update a conversation's metadata. Accepts JSON with required 'metadata' (object or null) and returns the updated conversation (id, object=conversation, metadata, created_at).
Adds POST /embeddings to create embedding vectors from input text or tokens with selectable model, optional dimensions, and encoding format. Returns embeddings, model, and usage info.
Introduces GET /evals to list project evaluations with pagination and ordering (after, limit, order, order_by); returns an EvalList of eval objects.
Introduces POST /evals to create evaluation definitions with a data source configuration and testing criteria; returns an Eval object.
Introduces DELETE /evals/{eval_id} to remove an evaluation by ID; returns deletion confirmation (200) or 404 if not found.
Introduces GET /evals/{eval_id} to retrieve an evaluation by ID, returning an Eval object (id, name, created_at, metadata) with data_source_config and testing_criteria.
Introduces POST /evals/{eval_id} to update an evaluations name and/or metadata by ID, returning the updated Eval object.
Adds GET /evals/{eval_id}/runs to retrieve a paginated, filterable list of runs for a specific evaluation, including run status, usage, results, and data source details.

Introduces POST /evals/{eval_id}/runs to start a new evaluation run with a specified data source (JSONL, completions, or responses) and optional model/sampling/tool configuration; returns an EvalRun on success.
Adds DELETE /evals/{eval_id}/runs/{run_id} to delete a specific eval run and return deletion status.
Introduces GET /evals/{eval_id}/runs/{run_id} to retrieve a specific evaluation run, including status, model, data source, usage stats, results, and report URL.
Added GET /evals/{eval_id}/runs/{run_id}/output_items to retrieve a paginated list of evaluation run output items with optional status filtering (fail/pass) and sort order (asc/desc).
Introduces GET /evals/{eval_id}/runs/{run_id}/output_items/{output_item_id} to retrieve a specific evaluation run output item, including sample, results, and metadata.
Adds POST /evals/{eval_id}/runs/{run_id} to cancel an ongoing evaluation run and return the canceled EvalRun object.
New GET /files endpoint that returns a paginated list of files with optional purpose filter, limit, order, and after cursor.
Adds POST /files to upload files via multipart/form-data (file, purpose, optional expires_after) for use across endpoints; returns a File object with metadata.
Adds GET /files/{file_id}/content to return the contents of the specified file (string).
Introduces DELETE /files/{file_id} to delete a file and remove it from all vector stores; returns {id, object:"file", deleted:true} on success.
Added GET /files/{file_id} endpoint to retrieve metadata about a specific uploaded file (OpenAIFile).

Introduces POST /fine_tuning/alpha/graders/run to execute a grader (string_check, text_similarity, python, score_model, or multi) on a model_sample with optional item context, returning a reward, sub_rewards, and detailed metadata including token usage, timing, and error flags.
Adds POST /fine_tuning/alpha/graders/validate to validate grader configurations for fine-tuning and return the validated grader object.

Added GET /fine_tuning/checkpoints/{fine_tuned_model_checkpoint}/permissions to list all permissions for a fine-tuned model checkpoint (admin API key required), with optional project_id filter, pagination, and ordering.

Adds POST /fine_tuning/checkpoints/{fine_tuned_model_checkpoint}/permissions to create permissions granting specified project_ids access to a fine-tuned model checkpoint. Requires an admin API key and enables org owners to share fine-tuned models across projects.
Organization owners can delete a permission for a fine-tuned model checkpoint (admin API key required).
Adds GET /fine_tuning/jobs to list your orgs fine-tuning jobs with pagination and optional metadata filtering (after, limit, metadata). Returns a list object with data[] and has_more.

Introduces POST /fine_tuning/jobs to create and enqueue fine-tuning jobs for supported base models. Accepts training_file (JSONL), optional validation_file, seed, suffix, metadata, integrations (W&B), and method configs (supervised, DPO, reinforcement) with hyperparameters. Returns a fine_tuning.job object with job details, status, model info, result files, and errors if any.
Adds POST /fine_tuning/jobs/{fine_tuning_job_id}/cancel to immediately cancel a fine-tuning job and return the updated FineTuningJob object.

Adds GET /fine_tuning/jobs/{fine_tuning_job_id}/checkpoints to list checkpoints for a specified fine-tuning job, with pagination via 'after' and 'limit'. Returns a list object of checkpoint resources (id, model checkpoint name, metrics, timestamps, step number).
New GET endpoint to retrieve status updates (events and metrics) for a fine-tuning job; supports pagination via 'after' and 'limit'.

Introduces GET /fine_tuning/jobs/{fine_tuning_job_id} to fetch details for a fine-tuning job by ID, returning a fine_tuning.job object with status, model, hyperparameters, timestamps, errors, and result file IDs.
Introduces POST /fine_tuning/jobs/{fine_tuning_job_id}/pause to pause a fine-tuning job and returns the updated fine_tuning.job object.
Introduces POST /fine_tuning/jobs/{fine_tuning_job_id}/resume to resume a fine-tuning job by ID and return the updated fine_tuning.job object.

Introduces POST /images/edits to edit/extend images from one or more sources using a prompt. Accepts multipart (binary image/mask) or JSON (image/file references), supports GPT image models and dall-e-2, optional masks, background/size/quality/format controls, n variants, and SSE streaming of partial/final images.

Added POST /images/generations to create images from a prompt with GPT image or DALL-E models. Supports background transparency, size, quality, output format and compression, number of images, and moderation; GPT image models support streaming partial/final images (base64); DALL-E can return URLs or base64 via response_format.
New POST /images/variations endpoint to create variations of a supplied square PNG using dall-e-2; supports n (1-10), size (256x2561024x1024), and response_format (url|b64_json).
Added GET /models endpoint to list available models with basic info (id, owner, created).
New DELETE /models/{model} endpoint to delete a fine-tuned model by ID. Requires Owner role; returns id, object, and deleted status.
Added GET /models/{model} to retrieve a specific model's details, returning a Model object with id, object="model", created (Unix timestamp), and owned_by. Requires path param `model` (string).
Introduces POST /moderations to classify text and/or image inputs for potential harm, returning per-category flags, scores, and applied input types.

Introduces GET /organization/admin_api_keys to retrieve a paginated list of organization admin API keys. Supports query params after, order (asc|desc), and limit. Response returns a list object (has_more, first_id, last_id) with admin API key items (id, name, owner, created_at, last_used_at, redacted_value).
Introduces POST /organization/admin_api_keys to create an admin-level org API key; returns key metadata and the secret value on creation.
Introduces DELETE /organization/admin_api_keys/{key_id} to delete a specified organization admin API key and return a confirmation payload.
Added GET /organization/admin_api_keys/{key_id} to retrieve details for a specific organization Admin API key by its ID.
Added GET /organization/audit_logs to list organization audit logs with filtering and pagination.
Added POST /organization/certificates/activate to atomically and idempotently activate up to 10 organization certificates and return the updated list.
Introduces POST /organization/certificates/deactivate to atomically and idempotently deactivate up to 10 organization-level certificates and return their details in a list response.
Adds GET /organization/certificates to list uploaded organization certificates with pagination and ordering.
Added POST /organization/certificates to upload PEM certificates to an organization; returns a certificate object and does not auto-activate it.

Introduces DELETE /organization/certificates/{certificate_id} to remove an organization certificate by ID; the certificate must be inactive for the org and all projects; returns {object:'certificate.deleted', id} on success.

Adds GET /organization/certificates/{certificate_id} to retrieve an uploaded organization certificate by ID. Optionally include=content to return PEM content; response includes id, name, created_at, and certificate_details (valid_at, expires_at, and optionally content).
Adds POST /organization/certificates/{certificate_id} to update a certificate's name and return the updated certificate object.

Introduces GET /organization/costs to retrieve organization cost details over a time range, bucketed daily (1d), with optional filtering by project_ids, grouping by project_id and/or line_item, and pagination via limit/page. Returns amounts with currency.

Introduces GET /organization/groups to list all organization groups with pagination (limit/after) and optional sort order (asc|desc). Returns a paginated list with group details (id, name, created_at, is_scim_managed).
Adds POST /organization/groups to create an organization group. Requires JSON body with 'name' (string). Returns 200 with group details (id, name, created_at, is_scim_managed).
Adds DELETE /organization/groups/{group_id} to delete a group and return a confirmation payload (object='group.deleted', id, deleted).
Adds POST /organization/groups/{group_id} to update an existing group's information (name) and return updated group details.

Added GET /organization/groups/{group_id}/roles to list organization roles assigned to a specific group, supporting pagination (limit, after) and sort order (asc, desc), returning a paginated list of role details.
Adds POST /organization/groups/{group_id}/roles to assign an organization role to a group; accepts role_id and returns the group-role assignment.
Adds DELETE /organization/groups/{group_id}/roles/{role_id} to unassign a role from a group and return a confirmation payload.
Introduces GET /organization/groups/{group_id}/users to list a group's users with pagination and sorting.
Introduces POST /organization/groups/{group_id}/users to add a specified user (user_id) to the target group and returns a confirmation payload.
Adds a DELETE endpoint to remove a user from a group. Returns 200 with confirmation payload (object='group.user.deleted', deleted:boolean).
Introduces GET /organization/invites to list organization invites with pagination (limit, after) returning invite objects and metadata.
Added POST /organization/invites to create an organization invite for a user; can optionally include project memberships granted upon acceptance.
Adds DELETE /organization/invites/{invite_id} to delete a specific invite by ID; cannot delete if already accepted. Returns object type, id, and deleted status.
Adds GET /organization/invites/{invite_id} to retrieve an organization invite by ID, returning email, role, status, timestamps, and granted project memberships.

Introduces GET /organization/projects to return a paginated list of organization projects. Supports limit (1-100, default 20), after cursor pagination, and include_archived (default false). Returns a list object with project items (id, object='organization.project', name, created_at, status, archived_at) plus pagination fields (first_id, last_id, has_more).
Adds POST /organization/projects to create a new organization project; requires name, optional geography; returns the created project object.
Adds GET /organization/projects/{project_id}/api_keys to return a paginated list of API keys in a project, including id, name, owner, created_at, last_used_at, and redacted_value.
Introduces DELETE /organization/projects/{project_id}/api_keys/{key_id} to remove a project API key, returning a deletion confirmation or an error if the key belongs to a service account.

Introduces GET /organization/projects/{project_id}/api_keys/{key_id} to retrieve details of a specific API key in a project, returning id, name, redacted_value, owner (user or service_account), created_at, and last_used_at.
Introduces POST /organization/projects/{project_id}/archive to archive a project and return the updated project (status set to 'archived' with archived_at).
Adds POST /organization/projects/{project_id}/certificates/activate to atomically and idempotently activate 110 certificates for a project and return the resulting project certificate list.

Adds POST /organization/projects/{project_id}/certificates/deactivate to atomically and idempotently deactivate up to 10 certificates for a specific project. Accepts JSON body with certificate_ids array and returns a list of affected certificates.

Adds GET /organization/projects/{project_id}/certificates to list a project's certificates with pagination (limit, after) and sort by created_at; returns certificate objects including PEM content, validity/expiry, and active status.
New route GET /organization/projects/{project_id} retrieves a project by ID and returns its details (id, name, status, created_at, archived_at).
New GET endpoint lists groups with access to a project; supports pagination (limit, after) and sort order (asc/desc).
Adds POST /organization/projects/{project_id}/groups to grant a specified group a project role, returning the created project-group membership.
Introduces DELETE /organization/projects/{project_id}/groups/{group_id} to revoke a group's access to a project and return a confirmation payload.
Added POST /organization/projects/{project_id} to modify a project's name and return the updated project.
Added GET /organization/projects/{project_id}/rate_limits to list a project's per-model rate limits with pagination.
Adds POST /organization/projects/{project_id}/rate_limits/{rate_limit_id} to update a project's rate limit configuration and return the updated project.rate_limit object.
Adds GET /organization/projects/{project_id}/service_accounts to list a projects service accounts with pagination (limit, after). Returns a list object; 400 if project is archived.
Added POST /organization/projects/{project_id}/service_accounts to create a project service account; accepts a name and returns the created account with an unredacted API key.

Adds DELETE /organization/projects/{project_id}/service_accounts/{service_account_id} to delete a service account from a project and return a deletion confirmation object; returns an error if the project is archived.
New GET endpoint to retrieve a specific service account within a project by project_id and service_account_id; returns object type, id, name, role (owner|member), and created_at.

Introduces GET /organization/projects/{project_id}/users to list users in a project with pagination (limit, after); returns a paginated collection of organization.project.user objects (id, name, email, role, added_at).
Introduces POST /organization/projects/{project_id}/users to add an existing organization member to a project with role owner or member; returns the created project user record on success.
Adds DELETE /organization/projects/{project_id}/users/{user_id} to remove a user from a project, returning a deletion confirmation object or an error if the project is archived.
Adds GET /organization/projects/{project_id}/users/{user_id} to retrieve a specific user in a project, returning id, name, email, role, and added_at.
Adds POST /organization/projects/{project_id}/users/{user_id} to change a user's project role (owner|member); accepts JSON {role}; returns the updated project user.

Adds GET /organization/roles to list organization/project roles with limit/after pagination and asc/desc ordering; returns a paginated list of role objects (id, name, description, permissions, resource_type, predefined_role).
Adds POST /organization/roles to create a custom organization role with a name, permissions, and optional description; returns the created role details.
Added DELETE /organization/roles/{role_id} to remove a custom role by ID and return a deletion confirmation payload.
Adds POST /organization/roles/{role_id} to update an existing organization role (name, description, permissions) and returns the updated role object.

Introduces GET /organization/usage/audio_speeches to fetch organization audio-speech usage over time, bucketed (1m/1h/1d) with filters (projects, users, API keys, models), optional grouping, and pagination; returns per-bucket characters processed and request counts.
Introduces GET /organization/usage/audio_transcriptions to retrieve org-level time-bucketed audio transcription usage (seconds, request counts) with filters, grouping, limits, and pagination.

Introduces GET /organization/usage/code_interpreter_sessions to retrieve organization-level, time-bucketed code interpreter sessions usage (num_sessions) over a specified time range, with bucket widths (1m/1h/1d), optional project_id filtering/grouping, limits, and pagination.

Introduces GET /organization/usage/completions to retrieve organization-level completions usage aggregated into time buckets (1m/1h/1d) over a time range, with optional filters (projects, users, API keys, models, batch), grouping (project_id, user_id, api_key_id, model, batch, service_tier), limits, and pagination; each bucket includes token counts and request counts.
Introduces GET /organization/usage/embeddings to fetch organization-wide, time-bucketed embeddings usage with optional filters (projects, users, API keys, models), grouping, limits, and pagination.

Introduces GET /organization/usage/images to retrieve bucketed organization image-usage data with filtering (sources, sizes, models, projects, users, API keys), grouping (project_id, user_id, api_key_id, model, size, source), pagination, and time range controls (start_time, optional end_time, bucket_width).

Introduces GET /organization/usage/moderations to return organization-level moderations usage, aggregated into time buckets (1m/1h/1d) with optional filters (project_ids, user_ids, api_key_ids, models), grouping (project_id, user_id, api_key_id, model), limits, and pagination.

Added GET /organization/usage/vector_stores to retrieve organization vector store usage aggregated in time buckets with optional project filters, grouping by project_id, pagination, and bucket widths (1m/1h/1d).
Introduces GET /organization/users to list organization users with pagination (limit, after) and optional email filtering; returns a list object of user records (id, name, email, role, added_at).
New DELETE /organization/users/{user_id} endpoint to remove a user by ID from the organization. Returns JSON with object='organization.user.deleted', id, and deleted=true on success.
New endpoint to retrieve a specific organization user by ID, returning a user object with id, name, email, role, and added_at.
Introduces POST /organization/users/{user_id} to modify a user's role in the organization to owner or reader, returning the updated user.
Introduces GET /organization/users/{user_id}/roles to list roles assigned to a user, with pagination (limit, after) and sort order; returns role details and pagination metadata.
Adds POST /organization/users/{user_id}/roles to assign an organization role to a user and return the role assignment.
Adds DELETE /organization/users/{user_id}/roles/{role_id} to unassign an organization role from a user and return a confirmation payload.
Adds GET /projects/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}/roles to list roles assigned to a group within a project, supporting pagination (limit/after) and sort order; returns detailed role assignment data.
Adds POST /projects/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}/roles to assign a specified project role (role_id) to a group within a project; returns the created group.role assignment on success (200).
Introduces DELETE /projects/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}/roles/{role_id} to remove a project role assignment from a group and returns a confirmation payload indicating deletion.
Adds GET /projects/{project_id}/roles to list roles configured for a project with pagination and sorting.
Introduces POST /projects/{project_id}/roles to create a custom project role with role_name, permissions, and optional description; returns role details.
New endpoint to delete a custom role from a project and return deletion confirmation.
Introduces POST /projects/{project_id}/roles/{role_id} to update an existing project role's name, description, and permissions, returning the updated role.

Adds GET /projects/{project_id}/users/{user_id}/roles to list roles assigned to a specific user in a project, supporting pagination (limit, after) and sorting (order), returning a paginated list of role details.
Added POST /projects/{project_id}/users/{user_id}/roles to assign a specified project role to a user within a project; returns the created user-role assignment with role and user details on success.
Adds DELETE /projects/{project_id}/users/{user_id}/roles/{role_id} to unassign a specific project role from a user and return a confirmation payload.

Adds POST /realtime/calls to initiate a WebRTC Realtime call by submitting an SDP offer and receiving a 201 SDP answer; supports raw application/sdp or multipart form with optional session configuration, and returns a Location header with the call ID for follow-up control.
Introduces POST /realtime/calls/{call_id}/accept to accept an incoming SIP call and apply a realtime session configuration (audio, model, VAD, etc.) before bridging to the model.
Introduces POST /realtime/calls/{call_id}/hangup to end an active Realtime call (SIP or WebRTC).
Introduces POST /realtime/calls/{call_id}/refer to transfer an active SIP call via SIP REFER to a specified target_uri.
Adds POST /realtime/calls/{call_id}/reject to decline an incoming SIP call, optionally specifying a SIP status_code (defaults to 603 Decline). Returns 200 on success.

Introduces POST /realtime/client_secrets to create short-lived client secrets with optional realtime or transcription session configuration; returns the secret value, its expiry, and the effective session.

Introduces POST /realtime/sessions to create an ephemeral API token (default 1-min TTL) and initialize a configurable Realtime session; returns the session object plus client_secret for client-side authentication.

Adds POST /realtime/transcription_sessions to create a realtime transcription session and return an ephemeral client_secret for browser authentication. Supports config for input audio format, optional noise reduction, transcription model (including diarization), and server VAD turn detection. Response includes the session plus an ephemeral key.
Introduces POST /responses/compact to compact long-running conversations into a summarized context and return a compacted response object with usage stats.
Introduces POST /responses/input_tokens to compute input token counts for a given Responses API-style request body and return { object: 'response.input_tokens', input_tokens: <int> }.

Introduces POST /responses to create model responses from text/image inputs, call built-in or custom tools (e.g., web/file search, code, image generation), and optionally stream SSE events; returns a rich response object with outputs, usage, and status.

Adds POST /responses/{response_id}/cancel to cancel an in-progress model response by ID. Only responses created with background=true are cancellable. Returns the Response object on success (200) or 404 if not found.
Adds DELETE /responses/{response_id} to delete a model response by ID; returns 200 on success or 404 if not found.
Introduces GET /responses/{response_id} to retrieve a model response by ID, with optional include expansions and SSE streaming (starting_after, include_obfuscation).
Added GET /responses/{response_id}/input_items to list items used to generate a response, supporting pagination (limit, order, after) and optional include fields for additional details.
Introduces GET /skills to list all project skills with pagination (limit, order, after) and returns skill objects plus pagination metadata.

New POST /skills endpoint to create a skill by uploading files (multipart directory via files[] or a single zip). Returns the created skill resource with id, name, description, created_at, default_version, and latest_version.
Adds GET /skills/{skill_id}/content to download a skill's zip bundle by ID; supports application/zip (binary) and application/json (string) responses.
Introduces DELETE /skills/{skill_id} to remove a skill by ID and return a deletion confirmation payload (object 'skill.deleted', id, deleted).
New GET /skills/{skill_id} endpoint to fetch a skill by ID, returning id, name, description, created_at, default_version, and latest_version.
Adds POST /skills/{skill_id} to set a skill's default version via default_version in the request body.
Introduces GET /skills/{skill_id}/versions to list a skills versions with pagination (limit, after) and sort order (asc|desc), returning a list and paging metadata.
New POST /skills/{skill_id}/versions endpoint to create an immutable skill version by uploading files (array of files or a zip) with optional default flag; returns version metadata.
Adds GET /skills/{skill_id}/versions/{version}/content to download a specific skill version's content as a zip bundle. Supports application/zip (binary) and application/json (string) responses.
Introduces DELETE /skills/{skill_id}/versions/{version} to delete a specific skill version and returns a confirmation payload (object=skill.version.deleted, id, version, deleted).
Adds GET /skills/{skill_id}/versions/{version} to retrieve metadata for a specific skill version (id, skill_id, version, name, description, created_at).

Added POST /threads to create a new thread. Supports optional initial messages, metadata, and tool_resources (code_interpreter file_ids or file_search vector stores). Returns a Thread object with id, created_at, metadata, and tool_resources.

Adds POST /threads/runs, allowing clients to create a new thread and immediately start a run with optional overrides (model, tools, response_format, truncation, token limits, streaming) and returns the Run object.
Adds DELETE /threads/{thread_id} to delete a thread by ID, returning confirmation with id, object='thread.deleted', and deleted flag.
Introduces GET /threads/{thread_id} to retrieve a thread by ID, returning its details and tool resources.

Adds GET /threads/{thread_id}/messages to return a paginated list of messages for a thread; supports limit, order, before/after cursors, and run_id filter; returns message objects with content, attachments, status, and metadata.
Adds POST /threads/{thread_id}/messages to create a message in a thread with text or multi-part content, optional image attachments, and metadata; returns the created message object.

Introduces DELETE /threads/{thread_id}/messages/{message_id} to delete a specific message in a thread; returns confirmation with id, object 'thread.message.deleted', and deleted flag on success (200).
Introduces GET /threads/{thread_id}/messages/{message_id} to fetch a specific message in a thread, returning the full message object (content, role, status, attachments, timestamps, metadata, etc.).
Introduces POST /threads/{thread_id}/messages/{message_id} to modify a messages metadata within a thread and return the updated message object.
Introduces POST /threads/{thread_id} to modify a thread by ID, allowing updates to metadata and tool_resources; responds with the updated Thread object.
New endpoint to list runs for a thread with pagination and ordering by created_at.

Introduces POST /threads/{thread_id}/runs to start an assistant execution on a thread. Requires assistant_id and supports adding messages, instruction/model/tool overrides, streaming, and response/usage details in the returned run object (including tool call actions).
Adds POST /threads/{thread_id}/runs/{run_id}/cancel to cancel an in-progress run and return the updated run object.
Introduces GET /threads/{thread_id}/runs/{run_id} to retrieve details of a specific run on a thread, including status, timestamps, tool calls, required actions, and usage.
Adds a new Assistants API endpoint to modify an existing run on a thread. Accepts metadata updates and returns the updated run object.
New endpoint to list run steps for a run within a thread; supports limit/order, before/after cursors, and optional inclusion of file search result content via include[].

Introduces GET /threads/{thread_id}/runs/{run_id}/steps/{step_id} to fetch a specific run step for a thread run, returning status, timestamps, step details (message creation or tool calls), usage, and optional file search result content via include[].

Adds POST /threads/{thread_id}/runs/{run_id}/submit_tool_outputs to submit outputs for required tool calls on a run; all outputs must be sent in one request, optional SSE streaming; returns the updated run object.
Adds POST /uploads to create an intermediate Upload that accepts file parts (up to 8GB, 1h expiry) and returns a pending Upload, later finalized into a File.
Adds POST /uploads/{upload_id}/cancel to cancel an existing Upload. After cancellation, no new Parts can be added. Returns the Upload object with status set to "cancelled".
Adds POST /uploads/{upload_id}/complete to finalize an Upload with ordered part_ids (optional md5), validate byte count, and return the completed Upload including a ready File.

POST /uploads/{upload_id}/parts: Upload a chunk (multipart form field 'data') to an existing Upload; returns UploadPart metadata. Supports up to 64 MB per part, 8 GB per upload, and parallel part uploads.
Added GET /vector_stores to return a paginated, sortable list of vector stores, including counts, status, and metadata.

New POST /vector_stores endpoint to create a vector store, with optional files, metadata, name/description, chunking strategy, and expiration; returns the created vector store with status and file counts.
Introduces DELETE /vector_stores/{vector_store_id} to delete a vector store and return deletion status (id, object='vector_store.deleted', deleted).

Adds POST /vector_stores/{vector_store_id}/file_batches to create a batch of files for a vector store from file_ids or per-file objects with optional attributes and chunking strategies; returns batch metadata, status, and file counts.
Added route-level description noting the 2000-file maximum per batch.
Increased maximum items for file_ids from 500 to 2000; description updated to mention the new limit.
Increased maximum items for files from 500 to 2000; description updated to mention the new limit.
Adds POST /vector_stores/{vector_store_id}/file_batches/{batch_id}/cancel to cancel processing of a vector store file batch and return the updated batch object (status and file_counts).
Adds GET /vector_stores/{vector_store_id}/file_batches/{batch_id}/files to list files in a vector store batch with pagination, ordering, and status filtering.
Introduces GET /vector_stores/{vector_store_id}/file_batches/{batch_id} to retrieve details of a vector store file batch, including status and file_counts.
Adds GET /vector_stores/{vector_store_id}/files to list files in a vector store with pagination, ordering, and optional status filtering; returns vector_store.file items and list metadata.
Adds POST /vector_stores/{vector_store_id}/files to attach an existing File (file_id) to a vector store, with optional attributes and chunking_strategy; returns the vector_store.file object.
Added GET /vector_stores/{vector_store_id}/files/{file_id}/content to retrieve parsed file contents (text items) from a vector store; paginated via has_more/next_page.
Adds DELETE /vector_stores/{vector_store_id}/files/{file_id} to remove a file from a vector store without deleting the file itself; returns {id, object: 'vector_store.file.deleted', deleted}.
Introduces GET /vector_stores/{vector_store_id}/files/{file_id} to retrieve a specific vector store file and its metadata (status, chunking strategy, usage_bytes, last_error, timestamps, etc.).
Introduces POST /vector_stores/{vector_store_id}/files/{file_id} to update or clear a file's attributes (metadata) within a vector store; returns the updated vector_store.file object.
Adds GET /vector_stores/{vector_store_id} to retrieve a vector store by ID, returning its metadata, status, file counts, usage, and timestamps.
Adds POST /vector_stores/{vector_store_id} to modify a vector stores name, metadata, and expiration policy, returning the updated vector store object.

Introduces POST /vector_stores/{vector_store_id}/search to retrieve relevant content chunks from a vector store using a query (string or list), optional attribute filters, ranking options, and optional query rewriting; returns scored chunks with file metadata plus pagination.

Introduces GET /videos to list recently generated videos for the current project. Supports optional query params: limit (max 100), order (asc|desc), and after (cursor) for pagination. Returns a list object of video job metadata (status, progress, timestamps, model, size, seconds) with pagination fields.

Added POST /videos to create a new video generation job from a text prompt and optional input_reference via JSON or multipart; supports model, duration (4/8/12s), and resolution selection; returns a job object with status and progress.
Adds GET /videos/{video_id}/content to stream the rendered MP4 video or a WebP preview asset (thumbnail or spritesheet) selected via the optional 'variant' query parameter.
Adds DELETE /videos/{video_id} to permanently delete a completed or failed video and its stored assets, returning a confirmation payload with id, deleted flag, and object=video.deleted.
New GET /videos/{video_id} endpoint to fetch the latest metadata for a generated video job, including status, progress, duration, size, and error details.
Adds POST /videos/{video_id}/remix to create a remix of a completed video using an updated prompt; accepts JSON or multipart with prompt and returns a video job.

Introduces GET /v1/video-generation-models to list all video generation models available to the authenticated API key, returning full model metadata (id, fingerprint, created, owner, version, input/output modalities, aliases). Requires bearerAuth; returns 200 with a models array.

Introduces GET /v1/video-generation-models/{model_id} to retrieve full details for a video generation model by ID (aliases, timestamps, fingerprint, input/output modalities, ownership, version). Requires bearer auth; returns 200 with model object, 400 for bad request, 404 if not found.
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to allowed target_languages enum for pre-recorded request_params.translation_config in job history items.
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to enum of allowed target_languages in pre-recorded request_params.translation_config.
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to translation target_languages enum and corresponding results languages.
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to allowed target_languages in request_params.realtime_processing.translation_config.
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to allowed languages in result.translation.results[*].languages.
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to enum of target_languages in request_params.realtime_processing.translation_config
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to enum of languages in translation.results items
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to allowed values for target_languages in item.request_params.realtime_processing.translation_config.
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to the enum of allowed target_languages in request_params.realtime_processing.translation_config.
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to allowed target_languages enum in request_params.translation_config.
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to allowed target_languages enum in translation_config within request_params.
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to allowed languages enum in translation results items.
Added 'wo' (Wolof) to translation target language enums in response schemas.
